sentences: Martin Taylor, MBE (born 20 October 1956) is a British jazz guitarist who has performed in groups, guitar ensembles, and as an accompanist.
Taylor was born in Harlow, Essex, into a family with a musical heritage and a Gypsy tradition.
The band Martin joined at 15 called the Oo-yah Band was led by Lennie Hastings, a jazz drummer who spent many years with the Alex Welsh band.
Over the next few years Taylor played in numerous bands, at holiday camps, on radio, and on cruise ships.
Performing dates in and around London brought him into contact with jazz guitarist Ike Isaacs, who became a mentor.
When Grappelli invited him to join full-time, Taylor accepted and performed and recorded with him for the next eleven years, occupying the position once held by his idol, Django Reinhardt.
He reduced some of his commitments and moved to Scotland.
Another benefit of his association with Grappelli was that he began to tour North America regularly, helping him reach a larger audience and build new relationships.
He met Chet Atkins and David Grisman and recorded with them in later years.
In the 1980s, Grappelli suffered a heart attack.
He became disenchanted with music and did not touch a guitar for almost a year.
After a few years, he stopped touring with Grappelli.
In 1991, Taylor performed in Australia, giving a solo performance on
Hey It's Saturday show.
During the 1990s, Taylor started the band Spirit of Django, which was inspired by Django Reinhardt and the Hot Club.
At a celebration for the film St√©phane Grappelli: A Life in the Jazz Century, Taylor performed with associates of Grappelli, including John Etheridge, Jack Emblow, and Coleridge Goode.
Since 2010, Taylor has been teaching guitar on his online school.
Throughout the 1990s he played a Yamaha AEX1500, which he helped develop.
In 2012, Peerless guitars announced the release of two guitars endorsed by Martin.

In 2018, in collaboration with UK based premium hand-crafted guitar specialist, Fibonacci Guitars (https://www.fibonacciguitars.com), the Martin Taylor branded Joya guitar was launched (https://martintaylorguitars.com/joya-op2/)
Member of the Order of the British Empire, awarded by Queen Elizabeth II (2002)
